verses.kjv: And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men’s sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man’s money in his sack’s mouth.
verses.ct: Joseph gave instructions to his house manager: "Fill the men's sacks with as much food as they can carry, and place each man's money back at the top of his sack."

verses.kjv: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack’s mouth of the youngest, and his corn money. And he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
verses.ct: "Then put my cup — the silver one — at the top of the youngest brother's sack, along with his grain money." The manager did exactly what Joseph told him.

verses.kjv: As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they and their asses.
verses.ct: At first light the next morning, the men were sent on their way with their donkeys.

verses.kjv: And when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off, Joseph said unto his steward, Up, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say unto them, Wherefore have ye rewarded evil for good?
verses.ct: They had barely left the city when Joseph told his house manager, "Go! Chase after those men. When you catch up to them, say, 'Why have you repaid kindness with betrayal?'"

verses.kjv: Is not this it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
verses.ct: "'Isn't this the cup my master drinks from — the one he uses for divination? What you've done is a terrible thing.'"

verses.kjv: And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.
verses.ct: The manager caught up to them and repeated these exact words.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:
verses.ct: They responded, "Why would my lord say something like this? Your servants would never do such a thing!"

verses.kjv: Behold, the money, which we found in our sacks’ mouths, we brought again unto thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steal out of thy lord’s house silver or gold?
verses.ct: "Look — the money we found at the top of our sacks, we brought all the way back from Canaan to return to you. So why would we steal silver or gold from your master's house?"

verses.kjv: With whomsoever of thy servants it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord’s bondmen.
verses.ct: "If it's found with any of us, that person should die, and the rest of us will become my lord's slaves."

verses.kjv: And he said, Now also let it be according unto your words: he with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.
verses.ct: He replied, "Fine, let it be as you say — but only the one who has it will become my slave. The rest of you will go free."

verses.kjv: Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
verses.ct: They quickly lowered their sacks to the ground and each one opened his sack.

verses.kjv: And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
verses.ct: The manager searched them, starting with the oldest and ending with the youngest — and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.

verses.kjv: Then they rent their clothes, and laded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
verses.ct: They tore their clothes in grief, loaded their donkeys back up, and returned to the city.

verses.kjv: And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph’s house; for he was yet there: and they fell before him on the ground.
verses.ct: Judah and his brothers arrived at Joseph's house while he was still there, and they dropped to the ground in front of him.

verses.kjv: And Joseph said unto them, What deed is this that ye have done? wot ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine?
verses.ct: Joseph said to them, "What is this you've done? Don't you realize that a man in my position has the ability to discover things through divination?"

verses.kjv: And Judah said, What shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold, we are my lord’s servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.
verses.ct: Judah answered, "What can we say to my lord? How can we explain this? How can we prove our innocence? God has exposed the guilt of your servants. We are now my lord's slaves — all of us, including the one who had the cup."

verses.kjv: And he said, God forbid that I should do so: but the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, get you up in peace unto your father.
verses.ct: But Joseph said, "I would never do that. Only the man who had the cup will be my slave. The rest of you — go back to your father in peace."

verses.kjv: Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord’s ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Then Judah stepped closer to him and said, "Please, my lord, allow your servant to speak directly to you, and don't be angry with me — because you hold the same authority as Pharaoh."

verses.kjv: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?
verses.ct: "My lord asked us, 'Do you have a father or another brother?'"

verses.kjv: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
verses.ct: "We told my lord, 'We have an elderly father and a young brother born to him in his old age. That boy's full brother is dead, so he's the only one left from his mother, and his father loves him deeply.'"

verses.kjv: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.
verses.ct: "Then you told your servants, 'Bring him down to me so I can see him myself.'"

verses.kjv: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
verses.ct: "We explained to my lord, 'The boy can't leave his father — if he did, his father would die.'"

verses.kjv: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
verses.ct: "But you told your servants, 'Unless your youngest brother comes with you, you will not be allowed in my presence again.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.
verses.ct: "When we went back to your servant, our father, we reported everything my lord had said."

verses.kjv: And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.
verses.ct: "Later our father said, 'Go back and buy us a little more food.'"

verses.kjv: And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man’s face, except our youngest brother be with us.
verses.ct: "We told him, 'We can't go back. We'll only go if our youngest brother comes with us, because the man won't see us unless our youngest brother is present.'"

verses.kjv: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:
verses.ct: "Your servant, my father, said to us, 'You know that my wife gave me 2 sons.'"

verses.kjv: And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since:
verses.ct: "'One of them left me, and I said he must have been torn apart by wild animals. I haven't seen him since.'"

verses.kjv: And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
verses.ct: "'If you take this one from me too, and something happens to him, you'll send this old man to the grave in misery.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad’s life;
verses.ct: "So now, if I return to your servant, my father, without the boy — since his very life is tied to the boy's life —"

verses.kjv: It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.
verses.ct: "the moment he sees that the boy isn't with us, he will die. Your servants will have sent our elderly father to the grave in sorrow."

verses.kjv: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.
verses.ct: "I personally guaranteed the boy's safety to my father, saying, 'If I don't bring him back to you, I will bear the blame for the rest of my life.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.
verses.ct: "So please, let me stay here as your slave in place of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers."

verses.kjv: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.
verses.ct: "How could I possibly go back to my father without the boy? I couldn't bear to witness the devastation it would bring on my father."
